1:
Save me, God;\q for the waters have put my life in danger.
\q
2:
I sink in deep mire, where there is no place to stand;\q I have come into deep waters, where the floods flow over me.


\q
3:
I am weary with my crying; my throat is dry;\q my eyes fail while I wait for my God.
\q
5:
God, you know my foolishness,\q and my sins are not hidden from you.
\q
6:
Let not those who hope in you be put to shame because of me, Lord Yahweh of hosts;\q let not those who seek you be brought to dishonor because of me, God of Israel.


\q
7:
For your sake I have borne rebuke;\q shame has covered my face.
\q
8:
I have become a stranger to my brothers,\q an alien to my mother's children.
\q
9:
For the zeal of your house has eaten me up,\q and the rebukes of those who rebuke you have fallen on me.


\q
10:
When I wept and did not eat food,\q they insulted me.
\q
11:
When I made sackcloth my clothing,\q I became the object of a proverb to them.
\q
12:
Those who sit in the city gate talk about me;\q I am a song of drunkards.


\q
13:
But as for me, my prayer is to you, Yahweh, at a time that you will accept;\q answer me in the trustworthiness of your salvation.
\q
14:
Pull me out of the mire, and do not let me sink;\q let me be taken away from those who hate me and rescued out of the deep waters.
\q
15:
Do not let the floods of water overwhelm me,\q neither let the deep swallow me up.
\q Do not let the pit shut its mouth on me.


\q
16:
Answer me, Yahweh, for your covenant faithfulness is good;\q because your mercies for me are many, turn to me.
\q
17:
Do not hide your face from your servant,\q for I am in distress; answer me quickly.


\q
18:
Come to me and redeem me.\q Because of my enemies, ransom me.
\q
19:
You know my rebuke, my shame, and my dishonor;\q my adversaries are all before you.


\q
21:
They gave me poison for my food;\q in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.


\q
22:
Let their table before them become a snare;\q when they think they are in safety, let it become a trap.
\q
23:
Let their eyes be darkened so that they cannot see;\q and always make their loins shake.


\q
24:
Pour out your indignation on them,\q and let the fierceness of your anger overtake them.
\q
25:
Let their place be a desolation;\q let no one live in their tents.


\q
26:
For they persecuted the one you struck down.\q They repeated the account of the pain of those you have wounded.
\q
27:
Accuse them of having committed iniquity after iniquity;\q do not let them come into your righteous victory.


\q
28:
Let them be blotted out of the Book of Life\q and not be written down along with the righteous.
\q
29:
But I am poor and sorrowful;\q let your salvation, God, set me up on high.


\q
30:
I will praise the name of God with a song\q and will exalt him with thanksgiving.
\q
31:
That will please Yahweh better than an ox\q or a bull that has horns and hooves.


\q
32:
The meek have seen it and are glad;\q you who seek after God, let your hearts live.
\q
33:
For Yahweh hears the needy\q and does not despise his prisoners.


\q
34:
Let heaven and earth praise him,\q the seas and everything that moves in them.
\q
35:
For God will save Zion and will rebuild the cities of Judah;\q the people will live there and have it as a possession.
\q
36: His servants' descendants will inherit it;\q and those who love his name will live there.
